com.example.groupproject_g3.utils

Interface PasswordValidator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.util.Optional<PasswordValidator.ValidationResult>>

    public interface PasswordValidator
extends java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.util.Optional<PasswordValidator.ValidationResult>>
    Interface to validate for correct password.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  PasswordValidator.ValidationResult

      default void processResult(java.util.Optional<PasswordValidator.ValidationResult> result, java.lang.Runnable onSuccess, java.util.function.Consumer<PasswordValidator.ValidationResult> onError)
      This helper method is a work around used since Android does not support java language features introduced after Java 1.8.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Function

        andThen, apply, compose, identity

    • Method Detail

      • checkPwdLength

        static PasswordValidator checkPwdLength()
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate the length of the String as greater than 6. When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s.length() > 6, otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_INVALID_LENGTH.
        Returns:
        a validator that validates the length of the String as > 6

      • checkPwdLength

        static PasswordValidator checkPwdLength(int length)
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate the length of the String as greater than 6. When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s.length() > length, otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_INVALID_LENGTH.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the String needed for validation
        Returns:
        a validator that validates the length of the String as > 6

      • checkPwdDigit

        static PasswordValidator checkPwdDigit()
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate that the String contains at least one digit. When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s contains at least one digit, otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_MISSING_DIGIT.
        Returns:
        a validator that validates that the String contains a digit

      • checkPwdUpperCase

        static PasswordValidator checkPwdUpperCase()
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate that the String contains at least one uppercase letter. When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s contains at least one uppercase letter, otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_MISSING_UPPER.
        Returns:
        a validator that validates that the String contains an uppercase letter

      • checkPwdLowerCase

        static PasswordValidator checkPwdLowerCase()
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate that the String contains at least one lowercase letter. When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s contains at least one lowercase letter, otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_MISSING_LOWER.
        Returns:
        a validator that validates that the String contains an lowercase letter

      • checkPwdSpecialChar

        static PasswordValidator checkPwdSpecialChar()
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate that the String contains at least one of these special characters: "@#$%&*!?". When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s contains at least one of these special characters: "@#$%&*!?", otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_MISSING_SPECIAL.
        Returns:
        a validator that validates that the String contains a special character

      • checkPwdSpecialChar

        static PasswordValidator checkPwdSpecialChar(java.lang.String specialChars)
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate that the String contains at least one of the characters found in specialChars. When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s contains at least one of the characters found in specialChars, otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_MISSING_SPECIAL.
        Parameters:
        specialChars - the characters to look for
        Returns:
        a validator that validates that the String contains a special character

      • checkPwdDoNotInclude

        static PasswordValidator checkPwdDoNotInclude(java.lang.String excludeChars)
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate that the String does NOT contain ANY of the characters found in excludeChars. When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s does NOT contain ANY of the characters found in exludeChars, otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_INCLUDES_EXCLUDED.
        Parameters:
        excludeChars - the characters to exclude
        Returns:
        a validator that validates that the String does NOT contain ANY of the characters found in excludeChars

      • checkExcludeWhiteSpace

        static PasswordValidator checkExcludeWhiteSpace()
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate that the String does NOT contain ANY whitespace as defined by Character.isWhiteSpace(). When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s does NOT contain ANY whitespace, otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_INCLUDES_WHITESPACE.
        Returns:
        a validator that validates that the String does NOT contain ANY whitespace

      • checkClientPredicate

        static PasswordValidator checkClientPredicate(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String> theTest)
        Returns a validator that when applied will validate a String based on theTest Predicate. When a String s is applied to the returning validator, it will evaluate to an Optional containing ValidationResult.SUCCESS when s passes theTest predicate, otherwise ValidationResult.PWD_CLIENT_ERROR.
        Parameters:
        theTest - a predicate to test the String for validation
        Returns:
        a validator that validates that the String based on theTest Predicate

      • checkStringContains

        static boolean checkStringContains(java.lang.String check,
                                   java.util.function.IntPredicate test)
        Helper, determines if the String check contains at least one character that test evaluates true for.
        Parameters:
        check - The String to test
        test - the character test
        Returns:
        true if check contains at least one character that test evaluates true for, false otherwise

      • and

        default PasswordValidator and(PasswordValidator other)
        Returns a composed PasswordValidator that represents a short-circuiting logical AND of this PasswordValidator and another. When evaluating the composed PasswordValidator, if this PasswordValidator in not successful, then the other PasswordValidator is not evaluated. NOTE: THIS is the Combinator!
        Parameters:
        other - a PasswordValidator that will be logically-ANDed with this PasswordValidator
        Returns:
        a composed PasswordValidator that represents a short-circuiting logical AND of this PasswordValidator and another

      • or

        default PasswordValidator or(PasswordValidator other)
        Returns a composed PasswordValidator that represents a short-circuiting logical OR of this PasswordValidator and another. When evaluating the composed PasswordValidator, if this PasswordValidator is successful, then the other PasswordValidator is not evaluated. NOTE: THIS is the Combinator!
        Parameters:
        other - a PasswordValidator that will be logically-ORed with this PasswordValidator
        Returns:
        a composed PasswordValidator that represents a short-circuiting logical OR of this PasswordValidator and another

      • processResult

        default void processResult(java.util.Optional<PasswordValidator.ValidationResult> result,
                           java.lang.Runnable onSuccess,
                           java.util.function.Consumer<PasswordValidator.ValidationResult> onError)
        This helper method is a work around used since Android does not support java language features introduced after Java 1.8. The Optional class introduced several helpful methods in Java 1.9 that should be used here instead of this.
        Parameters:
        result - the result of a validation action
        onSuccess - the action to take when the password successfully validates
        onError - the action to take when the password unsuccessfully validates
